demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'MobileSubscriber', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'subscriberID': {'title': 'Subscriber ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'phoneNumber': {'title': 'Phone Number', 'type': 'string'}, 'planType': {'title': 'Plan Type', 'type': 'string'}, 'activationDate': {'title': 'Activation Date', 'type': 'string', 'format': 'date'}}, 'required': ['subscriberID', 'phoneNumber', 'planType', 'activationDate']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I've just signed up for a new mobile subscription with Globex Telecom and I need to create a structured JSON object for my records and potential API integrations. My new subscriber ID is 'GTX-908472-MN', my assigned phone number is '+1234567890', I chose the 'Unlimited Data Plus' plan, and my service was activated on '2023-04-15'. Please generate a JSON object with these details.", 'role': 'user'}]

demos.json_schema: {"title": "NetworkSecurityPolicy", "type": "object", "properties": {"policyName": {"title": "Policy Name", "type": "string"}, "firewallRules": {"title": "Firewall Rules", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "object", "properties": {"ruleId": {"title": "Rule ID", "type": "string"}, "action": {"title": "Action", "type": "string", "enum": ["Allow", "Deny", "Limit"]}, "protocol": {"title": "Protocol", "type": "string"}, "portRange": {"title": "Port Range", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["ruleId", "action", "protocol", "portRange"]}}, "vpnRequirements": {"title": "VPN Requirements", "type": "object", "properties": {"vpnType": {"title": "VPN Type", "type": "string"}, "encryptionStandards": {"title": "Encryption Standards", "type": "string"}}, "required": ["vpnType", "encryptionStandards"]}}, "required": ["policyName", "firewallRules", "vpnRequirements"]}
demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'NetworkSecurityPolicy', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'policyName': {'title': 'Policy Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'firewallRules': {'title': 'Firewall Rules', 'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'ruleId': {'title': 'Rule ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'action': {'title': 'Action', 'type': 'string', 'enum': ['Allow', 'Deny', 'Limit']}, 'protocol': {'title': 'Protocol', 'type': 'string'}, 'portRange': {'title': 'Port Range', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['ruleId', 'action', 'protocol', 'portRange']}}, 'vpnRequirements': {'title': 'VPN Requirements', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'vpnType': {'title': 'VPN Type', 'type': 'string'}, 'encryptionStandards': {'title': 'Encryption Standards', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['vpnType', 'encryptionStandards']}}, 'required': ['policyName', 'firewallRules', 'vpnRequirements']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I'm currently setting up a network security policy for our company's IT infrastructure and I need to generate a JSON object that encapsulates our security requirements. The policy should be named 'SecureAccessPolicy'. It must include a set of firewall rules; one rule should allow HTTP traffic on port 80, another should deny FTP traffic on port 21, and a third should limit SSH traffic on port 22. Each rule needs a unique identifier, which are 'FR-001', 'FR-002', and 'FR-003' respectively. Additionally, the policy should specify our VPN requirements, which mandate the use of the 'L2TP' protocol and 'AES-256' encryption. This JSON object will be crucial for automating the deployment of our network security configurations.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'type': 'object', 'properties': {'HomeImprovement': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'room_interest': {'type': 'string'}, 'budget': {'type': 'number'}, 'preferred_style': {'type': 'string'}, 'project_ideas': {'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'string'}}}, 'required': ['room_interest', 'budget', 'preferred_style', 'project_ideas']}}}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I'm looking to spruce up my living room within a modest budget of $500. I prefer a minimalist style and would love some DIY project ideas that I can tackle over the weekend. Some ideas I'm considering are installing floating shelves for a clean look and extra storage, creating a gallery wall with my favorite prints and photographs, repainting the walls with a neutral color palette for a fresh feel, upcycling old furniture with a new coat of paint or new upholstery, and adding some greenery with low-maintenance indoor plants.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.completion: {"HomeImprovement": {"room_interest": "living room", "budget": 500, "preferred_style": "minimalist", "project_ideas": ["Install floating shelves for a clean look and extra storage.", "Create a gallery wall with your favorite prints and photographs.", "Repaint the walls with a neutral color palette for a fresh feel.", "Upcycle old furniture with a new coat of paint or new upholstery.", "Add some greenery with low-maintenance indoor plants."]}}

demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'properties': {'flightNumber': {'type': 'string'}, 'date': {'type': 'string', 'format': 'date'}, 'status': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'statusCode': {'type': 'string'}, 'statusMessage': {'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['statusCode', 'statusMessage']}}, 'required': ['flightNumber', 'date', 'status'], 'type': 'object'}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I'm tracking a specific flight for my travel planning and need to check its current status. The flight number is AA 100, scheduled for April 15, 2023. Could you please provide me with a JSON object containing the flight number, the date, and the current status information including the status code and status message? The status code should be 'ON_TIME' and the status message should read 'The flight is on schedule.'", 'role': 'user'}]

predictor.signature_instructions: Proposed Instruction: Transform the provided text with key-value pairs into a valid JSON object that conforms to the specified JSON schema. Ensure all required fields are included and that data types match the expected format in the schema. Use curly braces to encapsulate your resulting JSON structure, commas to separate items within an array, colons to separate keys from values, and quotation marks for string literals.

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:

{'type': 'object', 'properties': {'HomeImprovement': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'room_interest': {'type': 'string'}, 'budget': {'type': 'number'}, 'preferred_style': {'type': 'string'}, 'project_ideas': {'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'string'}}}, 'required': ['room_interest', 'budget', 'preferred_style', 'project_ideas']}}}
</schema>

I prefer a minimalist style and would love some DIY project ideas that I can tackle over the weekend. Some ideas I'm considering are installing floating shelves for a clean look and extra storage, creating a gallery wall with my favorite prints and photographs, repainting the walls with a neutral color palette for a fresh feel, upcycling old furniture with a new coat of paint or new upholstery, and adding some greenery with low-maintenance indoor plants.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.completion: {"HomeImprovement": {"room_interest": "living room", "budget": 500, "preferred_style": "minimalist", "project_ideas": ["Install floating shelves for a clean look and extra storage.", "Create a gallery wall with your favorite prints and photographs.", "Repaint the walls with a neutral color palette for a fresh feel.", "Upcycle old furniture with a new coat of paint or new upholstery.", "Add some greenery with low-maintenance indoor plants."]}}

retry_predictor.signature_instructions:
This signature is designed to handle errors in JSON object construction by focusing on identifying and rectifying the errors in the JSON output. The model uses this signature to understand the nature of the error and to guide the correction process in a retry mechanism. This is crucial for tasks requiring high accuracy in data format and structure adherence to a JSON schema.

    Instructions: Review the incorrect JSON object, identify the mismatches against the specified JSON schema, and modify the text or processing logic to correct these errors. The goal is to refine the JSON output in subsequent iterations until it fully complies with the JSON schema.
